titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of Jamestown 2007, 1986-2009
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 44449
titlepage.author: Craig S. Moore

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of Jamestown 2007, 1986-2009

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of Jamestown 2007, 1986-2009 (bulk 2002-2007). Accession 44449, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Jamestown-Yorktown Foundation on 20 August 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has been processed using minimal processing standards: the original arrangement has been maintained for the most part, the container list is brief and simple, and the records have not been refoldered and fasteners have not been removed.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: In 1996, the General Assembly amended article 23-292 of the Code of Virginia, to establish the Jamestown-Yorktown Foundation as the Commonwealth's authorized agency to "to perform the following actions directly related to the planning, coordination and implementation of the celebration of the 400th anniversary of the founding of Jamestown in 1607. Jamestown 2007 is a sub-agency of the Jamestown-Yorktown Foundation (JYF) created in 1997 to plan and implement commemorative events marking the 400th anniversary of the founding of Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in the Americas. From 1997 through 2004, the agency focused on developing the structure of the commemoration including recruiting volunteer board and committee leadership, conceptualizing the signature events, creating strategies to achieve the goals of the commemoration, forging partnerships with appropriate public and private organizations, seeking corporate sponsorships and building a staffing plan. By the beginning of 2005 a new phase of the commemoration work began with the movement from planning to implementation. Prosody Creative Services was retained through Jamestown 2007's private affiliate to produce the Godspeed Promotional Sail, the Yorktown 225th Anniversary, the National Teach-In and Anniversary Weekend. Other partnerships and consultants have been or are being selected to perform key roles in implementing the other signature events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Records of Jamestown 2007 are arranged in eight series. Series have been designated for History Files - Agency; Public Relations - Historically Significant; Recordings - Audio/Visual - Historically Significant; Project Documentation Files - Historically Significant; Planning Files - Administrative - Historically Significant; Special Interest Items; Correspondence/Subject Files - Agency Heads; and Correspondence/Subject Files - Other Officials - Historically Significant.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series II. Public Relations - Historically Significant, 2003-2008
Series III. Recordings - Audio/Visual - Historically Significant, 2006-2007
Series IV. Project Documentation Files - Historically Significant, 2000-2008
Series V. Planning Files - Administrative - Historically Significant, 2001-2007
Series VII. Correspondence/Subject Files - Agency Heads, 1997-2007
Series VIII. Correspondence/Subject Files - Other Officials - Historically Significant, 1996-2007

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Electronic records have also been transferred with these records.

did.unittitle: Series I: History Files - Agency, 1986-2008.

scopecontent.p: Series I: History Files contains minutes, reports, proposals, and other sundry items documenting the work of various committees including the Jamestown 2007 Steering Committee, Joint Steering Committee, Executive Committee, Creative Advisory Committee, Program & Events Subcommittee, Marketing & Finance Subcommittee, Logistics Subcommittee, Management Subcommittee, and the Historic Triangle Host Committee. In addition, the Celebration 2007 Committee documents early planning for the 400th anniversary.

Series II: Public Relations - Historicaly Significant, 2003-2008.

scopecontent.p: Series II: Public Relations is the largest series in the collection. This series contains binders of news clippings documenting various articles related to Jamestown and the 400th anniversary celebration between July 2003 through January 2008, especially in May 2007.

Series III: Recordings - Audio/Visual - Historically Significant, 2006-2007.

scopecontent.p: Series III: Recordings contains compact discs, videotapes, and other video recording formats documenting several anniversary events including the Godspeed Sail, Anniversary Weekend, Intertribal Festival, Smithsonian FolkLife Fest, Yorktown 225th Anniversary, and others.

Series IV: Project Documentation Files - Historically Significant, 2000-2008.

scopecontent.p: Series IV: Project Documentation Files documents commemorative productions and signature events created by Prosody Creative Services, Inc., an event marketing and management company based in Norfolk. Prosody was responsible for the Godspeed Sail, Jamestown Live!, America's Anniversary Weekend, and the World Forum on the Future of Democracy. This series also documents the various community programs held across the state and abroad.
